name: Physical Environment of the City
description: The physical structure of the city results in a distinctive local climate that is linked to air and water quality, as well as to energy use. A geographical information system is used to assemble physical information from which to model the urban climatic environment, taking the example of Mississauga. Particular emphasis is placed upon the role of field measurements and satellite data as sources of geographical information. [24L, 12P]
prerequisites: 0.5 credit from GGR214H5 or GGR217H5 or GGR227H5 and 0.5 credit from GGR272H5 or GGR276H5 or GGR278H5
